content.description: The crux is making the move to the top. Start on the jug.

The crux is the first move off the start hold, which is a slightly awkward dyno to a sharp edge. The rest of the route follows the arete with possibly another dyno to the crest of the boulder. It will be a scary topout being 15-20' off the deck.
content.protection: Probably 2-3 large pads and a good spotter would give some confidence for the topout.
content.location: On the uphill side of the Iceberg.

content.description: Stay on the lower rail leading to the stand start. The feet are bad and none of the holds are great leading to the arete. Pretty awesome alternative to the direct start while maintaining  some degree of difficulty.
content.protection: 2-3 pads for the top out and a spotter to follow you on the traverse with a pad.
content.location: Start about 20' left of the direct start of Ice Calving.

content.description:
This long, sandy crack is a striking line that can be seen from down the drainage. It also happens to be the easiest way off the massive boulder.

Low angled hand/fist crack, gets a bit wider the higher you go.

Not a place to second guess your downclimbing ability. A slip would land you into some serious trouble. It’s easy, but you absolutely would not want to fall down.
content.location: Massive splitter crack on a relatively low angled slab facing the drainage. Scramble up some washed out trees and start your quest upward.
